Package mmj.lang

Class ParseTree

java.lang.Object
mmj.lang.ParseTree
public class ParseTree extends Object
A simple tree structure to hold a ParseNode root.

  • Constructor Details

    • ParseTree

      public ParseTree()
      Constructor - default, creates empty ParseTree.

    • ParseTree

      public ParseTree(ParseNode root)
      Constructor - creates ParseTree using a ParseNode root.
      Parameters:
      root - the root node

    • ParseTree

      public ParseTree(ParseTree.RPNStep[] rpn)
      Build a ParseTree from an RPN Stmt array.

      Note: A Metamath proof may contain a "?" to indicate a missing step. Missing steps are stored in mmj.lang.Theorem.proof[] as a "null" stmt reference. --> if rpn[i] == null, throw IllegalArgumentException

      Parameters:
      rpn - Stmt array, may be parse or proof RPN.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if ParseTree cannot be built from the RPN (null statment or RPN incomplete.)

    • isDup

      public boolean isDup(int parseCount, ParseTree[] parseTreeArray)
      Check ParseTree array for duplicates.

      No longer used, except in BottomUpParser.

      Parameters:
      parseCount - number of trees in array.
      parseTreeArray - array of trees.
      Returns:
      true if duplicate found, else false.

    • isDup

      public boolean isDup(ParseTree parseTree)
      Check another ParseTree for duplication.

      No longer used, except in BottomUpParser.

      Parameters:
      parseTree - tree to compare.
      Returns:
      true if duplicate, else false.

    • deepCloneApplyingAssrtSubst

      public ParseTree deepCloneApplyingAssrtSubst(Hyp[] assrtHypArray, ParseNode[] assrtSubst, List<WorkVar> workVarList)
      (Deep) Clone a ParseTree while substituting a set of VarHyp substitutions specified by a parallel Hyp array and keeping count of the number of dummy VarHyp substitutions.

      This function is a helper for mmj.pa.ProofUnifier.

      Parameters:
      assrtHypArray - parallel array for assrtSubst
      assrtSubst - array of ParseNode sub-tree roots specifying hyp substitutions.
      workVarList - arrayList of WorkVar updated to contain set of Work Vars used in the subtree. substituted into the output.
      Returns:
      new ParseTree.

    • deepCloneApplyingAssrtSubst

      public ParseTree deepCloneApplyingAssrtSubst(Hyp[] assrtHypArray, ParseNode[] assrtSubst)
      (Deep) Clone a ParseTree while substituting a set of VarHyp substitutions specified by a parallel Hyp array.
      Parameters:
      assrtHypArray - parallel array for assrtSubst
      assrtSubst - array of ParseNode sub-tree roots specifying hyp substitutions.
      Returns:
      new ParseTree.

    • deepCloneApplyingWorkVarUpdates

      public ParseTree deepCloneApplyingWorkVarUpdates()
      (Deep) Clone a ParseTree while substituting a set of Work Var updates.

      This function is a helper for mmj.pa.ProofUnifier.

      Returns:
      new ParseTree.

    • findChildVarHypNode

      public ParseNode findChildVarHypNode(int childIndex)
      Finds first VarHyp within parseTree.root.child[i].

      This feat is useful for GrammarRule parse trees, which contain at most one VarHyp per root.child[i].

      Parameters:
      childIndex - index into ParseNode.child array.
      Returns:
      first VarHyp ParseNode at/under child[i].

    • convertToRPNExpanded

      public ParseTree.RPNStep[] convertToRPNExpanded()
      Convert ParseTree to RPN Stmt array.

      Notes on algorithm:

      1. We don't know the number of nodes in the tree in advance, so to generate a Java array of the proper size, we can either count, allocate and load, or load into a resizeable list structure then allocate and copy when the size is known. Pre-counting means traversing all of the nodes twice and then loading the array in reverse order (the top node must be at the end of the list). BUT there is overhead associated with resizeable lists and with the copy operation. Overall, the difference between the two methods is probably not much. So let's try pre-counting since the count logic can be separated and reused.
      2. we also don't know whether the ParseTree is a Syntax Parse Tree or a Proof Parse Tree, or even whether or not the ParseTree is "valid". That is not the concern of this routine, however.
      Returns:
      RPN Stmt array.

    • squishTree

      public ParseTree squishTree()
      Compresses ("squishes") the tree to re-use repeated subtrees.
      Returns:

    • countParseNodes

      public int countParseNodes(boolean expanded)
      Count parse nodes in a ParseTree.

      If root is null, count = zero.

      Parameters:
      expanded - true to count repeated subtrees multiple times, false to count them as size 1 stubs in subsequent occurrences
      Returns:
      number of parse nodes in ParseTree.

    • getMaxDepth

      public int getMaxDepth()
      Gets the maximum depth of the tree after calculating it if the answer is not already known.
      Returns:
      maximum depth of the parse tree

      Resets the maximum depth of the tree to the initial value.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Converts a ParseTree to a String consisting of Stmt labels in RPN order.

      Note: this can fail if the ParseTree is invalid. Intended for testing/diagnostic use.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String containing ParseTree statement labels in RPN order.
